channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: Numerous potholes, 26th November
item.description:
One from a poor repair on the apex of the hill heading to Churchdown. Another further down which appears to be a recent attempt to resolve an issue with bad levelling. It's already broken up
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hucclecote Lane, Churchdown, Tewkesbury

item.title: Road edge has broken away, 26th November
item.description:
The road edge outside 24 Draycot Road has broken down, leaving a long 'pothole' which makes it difficult to drive onto the drive without a bump in and out of the missing road surface. Please could it be filled in.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 26, Draycot Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked Road Gulley, 26th November
item.description:
This gulley has been full of silt for about 10 years. Every time there's steady rain for a day, a big puddle forms in front of St Gregory's Church.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Saint James Square, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kidnappers Lane, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Right thurn priority not working, 26th November
item.description:
There is a right turn arrow light that is not activating. This means that there is often a lot of traffic queuing in the right lane, but as the cycle never gives them priority against oncoming traffic, only one or two cars can get through at a time. This means there is often a long queue of cars in the right turn lane that blocks the traffic trying to go straight ahead too. I have seen this arrow turn on once or twice, shortly after the lights were turned on. But I've not seen it since, and certainly not when it's busy. Please resolve this issue to ensure right turn priority comes on every cycle, especially during rush hour.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Cheltenham Road, Longlevens, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Green or amber traffic light is not working

item.title: Concealed 1 inch raised concrete line, 26th November
item.description:
Outside Darwin house. Diagonal raised trip hazard, right on the walking route from Rodney Road car park in central shopping district. I fell and spent a 8 hours in Cheltenham general with facial injuries.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Regent Street, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Handrail fixings have come undone and handrail partially fallen down., 26th November
item.description:
